pffft
Class Command

java.lang.Object
  pffft.Command

public class Command
extends java.lang.Object

Allows the user to extend the program by providing their own commands.

Field Detail

args

protected java.lang.Object[] args
An array representing parameters passed to this command. When execute() is called, assuming the basic checks have passed, this array will hold a copy of the parameters, where they can be accessed. Guaranteed to be of same length as the initial parameter array, parameters[].

You'll have to cast from Object to the proper type you'd like. There's no guarantee of what exact Object each element will be, but it most likely will be a String.

Example usage: Say you have a command called 'define'. 'define' takes one String parameter. To access this parameter for your own use, call args[0] and cast it as a String. Easy!

audioGUI

protected pffft.AudioGUI audioGUI
A reference to the audio GUI object.

audioNetwork

protected pffft.AudioNetwork audioNetwork
A reference to the audio network object.

description

public java.lang.String description
The decription used by the command. The /help command uses this for the description.

While the description can be anything, the standard usage involves some notification of the number and type of parameters (ie, [String ip] or [int port]), and a short explanation of the command's intended effects.

gui

protected pffft.ClientGUI gui
A reference to the graphics object.

identifier

public java.lang.String identifier
The name used by the command. Typing '/' plus the identifier executes this command.

logger

protected pffft.ClientLogger logger
A reference to the logger object.

network

protected pffft.ClientNetwork network
A reference to the network object.

numParameters

public int numParameters
A helper integer that is equal to (parameters == null ? 0 : parameters.length).

parameters

public java.lang.Object[] parameters
A general Object array used to determine the arguments this command needs to be passed.

This array is initialised on creation of the command. While it's preferred to make this array contain examples of the parameters to be passed (ie, new Object[]{new String()}), this isn't essential.

The length of this array must be equal to the length of the array of arguments passed to this command for this command to execute.

parser

protected pffft.ClientParser parser
A reference to the parser object.

Constructor Detail

Command

public Command(java.lang.String name)
Creates a new Command that will be recognized by the ClientParser. This command will be parameterless.

Parameters:
name - The name of the command. If 'name' is "test", for example, then doing the command '/test' inside of the input text area will execute action().

Command

public Command(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String description)
Creates a new Command that will be recognized by the ClientParser. This command will be parameterless.

Parameters:
name - The name of the command. If 'name' is "test", for example, then doing the command '/test' inside of the input text area will execute action().
description - The formal description of the command, called on '/help' method. The recommended format includes information on usage, parameters, and any help the user needs.

Command

public Command(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String description,
               java.lang.Object[] parameters)
Creates a new Command that will be recognized by the ClientParser. This command will have parameters.

Parameters:
name - The name of the command. If 'name' is "test", for example, then doing the command '/test' inside of the input text area will execute action().
description - The formal description of the command, called on '/help' method. The recommended format includes information on usage, parameters, and any help the user needs.
parameters - A list of all of the parameters this command takes. This command will then expect the parameters to follow in this order when called.

Command

public Command(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String description,
               java.lang.Object[] para,
               pffft.DefaultCommandRunnable runnable)
This method is only used for default commands.

Method Detail

action

protected void action()
               throws java.lang.Exception
This method is overridden by the code you provide in commands.txt.

By default, this method returns without executing any code.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

execute

public final void execute(java.lang.Object[] para)
Execute the code inside of action, or run runnable. This code is run on another Thread to try to prevent the user from hanging the client with plugins. As a user, don't worry about this method.

Please try to be civil with your use of code. There are no checks in place on code passed, so this can cause instability on both your client and friends' clients.

init

public final void init(pffft.Client c)
Called by the ClientParser class to initialize this Command with any variables it needs to properly modify the program. Don't worry about this part; just know you can use the variables passed inside of your own Action.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of this Command.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
